Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of unidentified figure; exterior: wide and narrow bands, at least one with added red.
Curator's comments: For the short incised lines of the interior compare Stibbe 1972, pl. 47,2 (150), attributed to the Boreads Painter.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.05) (Phase 1)
